explains: adj. 全神贯注的，心事重重的；被先占的
v. 使全神贯注，占据（某人的思想）；提前占据（preoccupy 的过去式和过去分词形式）
wordGroup: preoccupied with 全神贯注于；沉浸在

sentences.en: His mannerisms are more those of a preoccupied maths professor.
sentences.cn: 他的言谈举止更像是一个全神贯注的数学教授。

sentences.en: He was preoccupied and had not even listened to Heidi's tales.
sentences.cn: 他全神贯注，甚至没有听海蒂的故事。

sentences.en: He was too preoccupied with his own thoughts to notice anything wrong.
sentences.cn: 他只顾想着心事，没注意到有什么不对。
